html.display_name: The Potential of Two Opposite Charges
html.p: A negative charge [mathjaxinline]-q[/mathjaxinline] sits on the positive [mathjaxinline]y-[/mathjaxinline]axis at a distance [mathjaxinline]a[/mathjaxinline] from the origin, and a positive charge [mathjaxinline]+q[/mathjaxinline] sits on the negative [mathjaxinline]y-[/mathjaxinline]axis at the same distance [mathjaxinline]a[/mathjaxinline] from the origin. What is the electric potential everywhere on the [mathjaxinline]y-[/mathjaxinline]axis?
